Simply an amazing experience. Helpful and friendly staff, beautiful and modern rooms, and the breakfast buffet is of its own accord worth a trip to Chennai! We’ve stayed several times and will be back many more!

I want to specifically mention Sherina from the concierge who was lovely and particularly helpful with numerous requests, Subbu at Anise who makes the best teas and coffees you can imagine, and also Kuppu whose warmth made us feel at home. The whole team is wonderful, and we are deeply grateful for an awesome stay.

Tan was an excellent luxurious experience. Breakfast buffet was a gorgeous feast every morning.
Hospitality was impeccable.
We had the best care possible.
Particularly we would like to thank catering assistant, Mr. Kuppusamy & Sous Chef, Mr. Dayalan for the way they looked after our every need. Their personal touch put our experience of breakfast on a completely different level.

text.text:
I had the pleasure of staying at the Taj Hotel a few months ago during my visit from Punjab, and I must say it was an unforgettable experience. The highlight of our stay was undoubtedly the exquisite food offered at the hotel. Every meal was a culinary delight, with a diverse range of dishes that catered to various tastes. From traditional Punjabi cuisine to international delicacies, the hotel's restaurant truly exceeded our expectations.

What made our stay even more enjoyable was the exceptional service provided by the hotel staff, particularly Jasmine. She went above and beyond to ensure that we had a comfortable and memorable stay. Her warm hospitality and willingness to assist with any request truly stood out. Jasmine's attention to detail and dedication to making our stay special left a lasting impression on us.

The hotel itself was a haven of luxury and elegance, with well-appointed rooms, stunning decor, and impeccable cleanliness. The attention to detail in every aspect of the hotel's design and maintenance was evident throughout our stay.

In summary, our experience at the Taj Hotel was nothing short of extraordinary. The combination of outstanding food, a luxurious environment, and the exceptional service of staff like Jasmine made our stay truly remarkable. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area, and I look forward to returning in the future.

Review from my Dad (Yadwinder Singh)

editorialSummary.text: Polished quarters in an upmarket hotel with restaurants & a nightclub, plus a spa & an outdoor pool.

text.text:
The hotel effectively aligns its pricing with the amenities it offers, creating a harmonious balance. The establishment boasts a pleasing ambiance that enhances the overall guest experience. However, a notable drawback is the presence of only two elevators, both of which operate at a relatively sluggish pace. This can be inconvenient, as extended wait times ensue if one of the elevators halts, affecting the timely access to different floors.

The rooms are well-appointed, contributing positively to the overall impression of the stay. Nonetheless, there is a discernible discrepancy in the bathroom size in relation to the generous dimensions of the rooms. The bathrooms may be perceived as somewhat cramped compared to the spaciousness offered in the rest of the room. Despite this minor concern, the hotel's favorable pricing strategy, coupled with its commendable facilities and inviting atmosphere, contributes to a generally positive assessment. Addressing the elevator speed and bathroom size could further elevate the guest experience and ensure a more seamless stay.

text.text: This was one of the worst hotels stays I have had. First of all, this is NOT a 5 star hotel. Maybe it once was but it cannot claim to be one anymore. I don't know of any 5 star hotels that don't have running hot water. I had to call someone from reception when I needed hot water for a bath and someone brought hot water in a bucket with a mug!! There was a musty moldy unpleasant smell throughout the hotel. The first room I got had such a strong smell of mold and the bathrooms smelled of sewage so I asked for a room change. The rooms are super old and in need of an update. Nearly all the pieces of furniture are scuffed, chipped and damaged. My bed linen was stained as was the chair in the room. Cleanliness is not at all a priority at the park. There was dirt and grime on the corners of the room, the windows had not been cleaned in ages and the carpets in the halls were littered with matchsticks and little pieces of trash. There were towels soaking up water on the floor in some places in the hallway. The worst part was that I got very sick from the food after ordering room service in the night. I was up throwing up all night because of it.  The chef and staff very apologetic about this later which I appreciate.  The breakfast spread was also decent. Everything is super over priced though including the food, the shuttle service(Rs. 2200 for airport v/s Rs.360 on OLA) and the room itself. It is worth less than half that in my opinion. My understanding is that the only reason this place continues to operate is because of its proximity to the US consulate.  It is a short walk away and was super convenient. However, the convenience was not worth the hit in comfort of stay and I will never be staying in this hotel again even if I have work at the consulate. Save your money and stay some place else and invest the money in cab fare.

text.text:
For my 7 days trip to Chennai this time I decided to book 3 different hotels just to choose the best one which I might choose the next time I visit. Previous stayed in residency tower but was fully booked this time.

Anyways, it’s true that this ain’t a 5 star hotel. More to a 3 star perhaps. But the hospitality was really great. The 23 year old (if I remember correctly) needs a lot of revamping.

Walking to a bar which was very noisy wasn’t a good impression together with the not so welcoming lights. Their staff were very helpful.

Walking towards the room was also not pleasant as there was a kind of stale smell. Like old, or maybe wet floor and cockroach smell or something like that. But to their defense I didn’t see anything crawling around.

Inside the room I had the same smell which really bothered me. But I didn’t complain as there was nothing they can do about it.

If only the room sliver finishing could be cleaned properly like the sink hole and all and the smell of the hotel itself can change, maybe it will give better vibes to customers.

It’s a good hotel and I wish you could be great one day…..

Hilton Chennai exceeded all expectations for a memorable stay. The modern, welcoming atmosphere and comfortable yet sophisticated rooms set the tone. The staff's friendliness and proactive assistance made me feel truly valued.

Dining was a highlight, with a diverse and delicious breakfast spread and exceptional on-site restaurants. The amenities, including a well-equipped fitness center and a refreshing pool, added to the overall experience.

The hotel's strategic location made it easy to explore the city, making Hilton Chennai a standout choice for a luxurious and convenient stay. Highly recommended for both business and leisure travelers.

editorialSummary.text: Posh rooms in a contemporary hotel with 3 restaurants & 2 bars, plus an outdoor pool & a spa.

text.text:
One of the oldest and iconic hotels in Chennai (actually Madras, considering it more represents that era than the present). While still fairly well maintained and complete with most amenities & luxuries, the hotel is sort off showing it's age. It looks a tad worn out and dated (low ceilings, old fashioned furniture, etc.), that said it's still clean, fairly well appointed, and has functional amenities.
That said, the location and breakfast is very good. And the accomodation at fair rates is a very good value for money proposition.

editorialSummary.text: Contemporary hotel featuring free breakfast & Wi-Fi, plus a cigar lounge, an outdoor pool & a spa.

text.text:
My stay in Radisson was for two nights and three days. On the day of arrival, our receptionist was super confused. She did not know if we were arriving or leaving the hotel.
The room stay was comfortable. I had opted for a twin bed room. Just one small feedback, the office chair in the room is not comfortable and therefore not the best space to work. Also, the room smelled a little moist as soon as we entered but the smell went away after the air-conditioning was switched on.
In room dining service was slow.
The breakfast buffet was good, though the staff was always never around even at 7 AM despite their buffet starting time being 6:30.
Overall, they need to work on their service. Everything else was on point.

text.text: I had to stay at the Radisson Blu Hotel because of some repair work at home. I was pleasantly surprised to find that I was upgraded to a suite from my existing category. The room was huge with an outside sitting area. The mini bar was fully stocked with a full size refrigerator. The food ordered came within 30 minutes. However, there can be some outside noise at night from the vicinity. The breakfast next day was satisfactory with a very wide spread. The service and table manners by the staff was polite and courteous. All in all it was a very pleasant experience !

text.text:
Location is prime and one will find extremely helpful valets and security.
Reception desk- personally we were not happy with the services :
1) Despite a confirmed booking and online check in + calling to inform about expected time of check in , the rooms were not ready.
2) We were made to wait for nearly 45 mins before we finally checked in
3) Don't fall for the -We will upgrade you to Suite Room at no additional cost OFFER.
It's on the smoking floor and in our case, I sensed it was only a ploy that was offered to buy time to get the alloted room ready
4) The reception desk employees speaking in hushed tones and regional language in front of the desk is bound to raise suspicion in the guest's mind. This could be avoided.
5) SMILE - Was missing :(.  A genuine smile is a rarity nowadays and hence didnt expect either , hence not disappointed. But I guess it makes a world of difference to the guests at the reception desk or the finedine restaurant .
6) Room service was prompt and no laxity . Great job.
7) Having experienced stays at Radisson Blue at other locations ( Coimbatore , Cochin and Mysore, was a bit disappointed with the overall experience at Chennai .

4) The reception desk employees speaking in hushed tones and regional language in front of the desk is bound to raise suspicion in the guest's mind. This could be avoided.
5) SMILE - Was missing :(.  A genuine smile is a rarity nowadays and hence didnt expect either , hence not disappointed. But I guess it makes a world of difference to the guests at the reception desk or the finedine restaurant .
6) Room service was prompt and no laxity . Great job.
7) Having experienced stays at Radisson Blue at other locations ( Coimbatore , Cochin and Mysore, was a bit disappointed with the overall experience at Chennai .

I should also say that you can get a proper espresso in the lobby, although you will pay through the nose for it.I recently had the pleasure of staying at this beautifully decorated and modern hotel, and I must say it was an outstanding experience, largely due to the exceptional service provided by the staff.
From the moment I walked in, the staff's kindness and professionalism were evident in every interaction. However, it was Richa at the front desk who truly stood out. Her knowledge, friendliness, and willingness to assist with any questions or minor issues made our stay all the more memorable. She was prompt, efficient, and went above and beyond to ensure our comfort.
The hotel's aesthetic appeal is undeniably impressive, but it's the staff's dedication to providing excellent service that sets this establishment apart. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone seeking not only a visually pleasing environment but also an exceptional level of service.
Kudos to Richa and the entire team for making our stay truly amazing!

editorialSummary.text: Polished rooms & suites in a premium lodging with 3 restaurants, a hip nightclub & an outdoor pool.

text.text:
Looking for a great experience? Look somewhere else. Close proximity to the airport made this an ideal choice but I didn’t know what I was getting into.
The management is aware but shameless about their business at this property. Basic needs like confirmed reservation is NOT GUARANTEED. Forget about staying a night at one of their rooms. They’ll gladly offer you the lobby for whatever money you’ve spent.
I had booked an Executive King room to spent the night before my international flight the next morning. When I arrived at the hotel, the front desk staff asked me if I needed a taxi for Rs. 1200 after checking me in and before asking me to wait in the lobby because the room isn’t ready yet. I waited in the lobby, for 3  hours before I decided to leave and just spend my night at the airport. The staff, including the management had no answer as to why my room wasn’t ready six hours after my check-in time. Later I figured it wasn’t the issue with just my reservation, there were plenty of unhappy guests for the same reason. They oversold and they didn’t have enough rooms. They were making unnecessary excuses and making the guests wait.
Would never go back if I get a chance and would not recommend this property to anybody I know in Chennai.
If you want to deal with a conning and deceiving management, this is your to-go place. Marriott could do so much better.

text.text:
Stay was average. The room was big and bed was good. Other than that nothing was impressive. The room was not clean. The bathroom sink was not draining properly. The walls were dirty and there was water seepage. No hot water in the bathroom or shower.

The in room dining staff don’t allow food from outside and ask money for providing plates. For plates they charge 2000rs cover charge which is just ridiculous. It is a very archaic rule and hotel should change with the times. There are a lot of great food options outside and the hotel should not restrict people from this.

Hotel is like a maze, it takes 5-10 mins to reach the lobby and lift as no clear instructions are given anywhere on how to get there.

Overall wouldn’t recommend anyone to stay here unless you really need to.

text.text:
Very disappointed in this hotel, no where close to being a 5 star property. The hotel itself is very old and once you get to the rooms you can very easily tell.
- The corridors were very musty and dark.
- The carpet in the room was stained and looked very dirty, I hope they are cleaning it.
- There was hair in the bathtub and the toilet seat was broken. Very subpar quality. There is also very bad smell coming from the bathroom.
- The breakfast buffet had a large variety but the quality wasn't great. The service was even worse, the tables weren't cleared and if you need anything you have to ask multiple times.

Overall very disappointed and will not be returning to this property. This property should not be marketed as a 5 star property. It is not.

Revel in Heartfelt Hospitality

These virtues have sustained and solidified an emotional connection with our guests for over 30 years. Decked with fully-automated, opulent rooms and the city’s most-anticipated fine-dining experiences, our hotel treats guests to a sophisticated and elegant stay in Chennai.

This 5-star hotel in T Nagar celebrates its strategic placement, close to several IT hubs, hospitals, travel hubs and tourist places. It is just a 32-minute drive from Chennai International Airport, 5.3 km from Egmore Railway Station, 3.5 km from the US Consulate and a mere 700 m from the Singapore Embassy.

text.text:
The common areas are clean, and the hotel's interior design exudes a sense of comfort.
The staff at a radha Hotel provided excellent service throughout my stay. They were courteous, attentive, and always willing to assist with any inquiries or requests. The check-in process was smooth, and the concierge was particularly helpful in providing local recommendations.
The rooms were comfortable and well-appointed. The bed was cozy, and the amenities provided were sufficient for a pleasant stay. Housekeeping did a commendable job in maintaining cleanliness, and the room service was prompt and efficient.
While the hotel restaurant offered a decent selection of dishes, I found the dining experience to be slightly lacking in terms of variety. The food quality was good, but I believe there's room for improvement in expanding the menu options.
Hotel is conveniently located, making it easy to access key attractions and transportation hubs. It's situated in a relatively quiet area, providing a peaceful retreat while still being close to the city's main points of interest.

text.text:
Recently, on 9 & 10 December, my wife and I booked a room for 2 days in Chennai Feathers Radha hotel.  We are from Singapore and we believed that the hotel would maintain a considerably high standard in terms of food quality. The very next day, around 4.30 am, my wife placed an order for cups of tea, as we had to attend a wedding in the early morning. The tea they served tasted very strange and yet we had it trusting hotel's food hygiene standard and we were also in a hurry. Within an hour, my wife began experiencing bouts of vomiting and diarrhea, after which we realized that the tea we drank had gone bad. My wife traveled back to Singapore that night with all the pain. It took her around 4 days to recover from the food poisoning.
Hence, we are deeply disappointed with the poor food standards of this hotel.

PS: Hire more experienced individuals with a considerable flair in English as staff. We had a hard time communicating with them to have our needs met.

editorialSummary.text: Warm rooms & suites in a refined hotel with pan-Asian dining, a 24/7 coffee shop & an outdoor pool.

text.text:
We went in a big group for and informal get together with Dinner. Since there were more than 20 of us we took their Private Dining area. The place was nice and the decor also, However, the staff were very non friendly and abrupt. They were not rude, but not polite either.
It started with them telling that we cannot do a "photoshoot" in the lobby, when we were taking photos of our kids. They did not allow us to take any group photo except in the private dining area, where there were sharp focus lights so the photos came out very bad.
The best part was that after telling us not to take any photos, we found their own staff, that too on duty, taking photos of themselves in the same lobby! One rule for the guests and another for the staff? Very weird.
Parking was another issue. They do not have a basement parking and insist on valet. Since I never give my vehicle for valet, I took my car and parked it somehow. One of my friends gave his new Mercedes to the valet, and when we got the car back, there was a  long time across two doors, which the hotel team kept insisting was already there before we gave for the valet.
CCTV footage showed that the scratch was not there at the time of giving to the valet for parking, but still the hotel was not ready to accept the point.
Finally we had no choice but to leave.
The good food and the ambiance and our nice mood was spoilt by the attitude of the staff all around

text.text:
Nice rooms, friendly staff, great food, perfect location

1. Best hotel rooms I have come across, even better than Hyatt, Mariott, and ITC group hotels
2. Friendly hotel staff, accomodate your requests the best they can
3. The architecture of the hotel is one of its kind, even from the inside. travelling up and down the lift is an experience in itself
4. The food is out of this world. Really good.
5. Perfect location: walkable from airport metro station which also takes you to MGR Chennai railway station, and near malls and zoo and other tourist locations

Disliked · Outside food is not allowed. But not a deal breaker. There is subway and other supermarkets nearby (just beside the building), so you can walk and eat fruits at supermarket or subway meal at subway.

text.text:
Worst Marriott Hotel in Chennai to stay. I booked 3 night stay using my points for my family to stay and requested early check-in. They accepted for an early check-in on a phone call but charged 1/2 a day when checked in during our stay. Also charged for one additional person during check-in (which is okay) but charging few thousands for additional bed is not okay. I feel like this place is very interested in money over hospitality. If you don't encourage points based stay, please remove the option. Don't charge for every single thing and make the experience unpleasant.

WORST STAY EVER!!!

text.text:
Novotel offers a delightful ambiance upon entering, with a lobby that exudes warmth and comfort. The rooms are commendable, meeting initial needs and providing a comfortable stay. However, my experience with room service was subpar, as they took an extended 1 to 2 hours to respond, despite three calls.

The restaurant, on the other hand, stands out with its healthy and varied food options. The staff in the restaurant are noteworthy for their excellent service, creating a positive dining experience. Despite the setback in room service, the overall stay was enjoyable, with the culinary offerings and restaurant staff contributing significantly to the positive aspects of the visit. Addressing the delay in room service would undoubtedly elevate the overall guest satisfaction at Novotel.
